data.title: Movies with September in the title
meta_keywords: Movies with September in the title
data.meta_description: Do you know September served as a motif for many Hollywood films?
data.text:
Come September (1961)

It’s a rom com directed by Robert Mulligan, and starring Rock Hudson, Gina Lollobrigida, Sandra Dee and Bobby Darin. Set in picturesque Italian locales, it’s a film about finding and losing love, as seen through the eyes of a sets of pairs belonging to different age-groups. Bobby Darin was making his debut with the film and fell in love with Sandra Dee and eventually married him, thus getting himself a happy ending in real life.

Until September (1984)

Well, Roger Ebert called it a dumb, pointless boring romance… but this film, directed by Richard Marquand and starring Karen Allen, Thierry Lhermitte and Christopher Cazenove does have its heart in the right place. It revolves around the heroine losing her luggage when she lands in Paris and getting seduced by a Parisian as she waits for the airline to fix her problem. The duo develop feelings for each other and end up falling in love.

September (1987)

Directed by Woody Allen and starring Mia Farrow, this film doesn’t star Allen nor is it a comedy. It’s a straight drama modeled on Anton Chekhov's play Uncle Vanya. It has a remarkable array of actors, including Sam Waterston, Dianne Wiest, Elaine Stritch, Jack Warden, and Denholm Elliott. It’s a moving saga about encountering the ghosts one’s past and moving on in life. Allen reportedly shot the film earlier with a different set of actors, then disliking the finished product , rewote it, reshot it and reedited it.

See You in September (2010)

It’s an oddball comedy directed by Tamara Tunie and stars Estella Warren, Michael Rispoli, Whoopi Goldberg, and Justin Kirk. Lindsay (Estella Warren) is a successful ad films producer but doesn’t have a great personal life. She relies on her shrinks to solve her problems. However, one day, he doctor goes on a long vacation and she comes up with a plan to start a support group of her own. The plan backfires when two thieves enter in the guise of victims, rob them all and leave them tied in the apartment. Funnily enough, as all they could do is talk, the group starts corresponding and each member finds a solution to his or her unique problems.

Septembers Of Shiraz (2015)

Directed by Wayne Blair and written by Hanna Weg, it’s based on Dalia Sofer's 2007 novel The Septembers of Shiraz. The film stars Adrien Brody, Salma Hayek, Shohreh Aghdashloo, Anthony Azizi, Bashar Rahal and Alon Aboutboul. It tells the moving story of a Jewish family caught in the cross fire of religious extremism when the Shah Of Iran was overthrown by the fundamentalists.
